word: A cousin of Calvin's, who had joined the reformers, was in Paris. The two kinsmen often met, and discussed together the matters that were disturbing Christendom. \93There are but two religions in the world,\94 said Olivetan, the Protestant. \93The one class of religions are those which men have invented, in all of which man saves himself by ceremonies and good works; the other is that one religion which is revealed in the Bible, and which teaches men to look for salvation solely to the free grace of God. \93I will have  none of your new doctrines,\94 exclaimed Calvin; \93think you that I have lived in error all my days?\94
